DOC.brief_summary: The aim present study evaluate bite force upper removable partial denture construct two different flexible thermoplastic material .
DOC.brief_title: Comparative Study Biting Force Injection Molded PEEK Bre.Flex Removable Partial Dentures .
DOC.detailed_description: The patient treat visit designate follow : Visit 1 : Preoperative record , clinical , radiographic examination ( panoramic periapical x-rays evaluation crown-root ratio , apical condition abutment alveolar bone support abutment ) primary impression perform irreversible hydro-colloid impression material ( alginate ) , The impression pour type IV dental stone obtain diagnostic cast . Visit 2 : Maxillary Face-bow record . The diagnostic cast mount semi adjustable articulator centric occlude relation evaluate interarch distance occlusal plane . Visit 3 : primary surveying perform . Special tray construct Mouth preparation perform prepare guide plane rest seat prepare oppose edentulous area . Final impression take elastomeric impression material . The impression pour type IV dental stone order obtain master cast . The master cast survey . The proposed design follow : metal framework base saddle edentulous area side connect palatal strap . Aker 's clasp abutment buccal retention . Visit 4 : metal framework try patient 's mouth . Jaw relation record . Visit 5 : The denture base try acrylic teeth patient 's mouth . Visit 6 : denture base partial denture process incorporation metal framework two different material evaluate . The first group receive partial denture metal framework incorporate denture base fabricate PEEK material . The second group receive partial denture metal framework incorporate denture base material fabricate BRE-FLEX . Visit7,8,9 : clinical measurement perform one month three visit .
DOC.criteria: . All patient must Kennedy class III modification I upper partially edentulous ridge . ii . The remain teeth good periodontal condition , sign attrition gingival recession . iii . Male female patient age range ( 4555 ) good medical condition iv . All patient skeletal Angle 's class I maxillomandibular relationship sufficient interarch distance . v. Free systemic neuromuscular disorder might affect chew efficiency masticatory muscle . vi . Free tempromandibular joint disorder . vii . The patient good oral hygiene low caries index . . Patients abnormal habit bruxism clench ii . Patients hormonal disorder diabetes , thyroid parathyroid hormonal disease include . iii . Teeth compromise bone support . iv . Patient xerostomia excessive salivation . v. Patient abnormal tongue behavior and/or size .
